intro: Pycnocoma, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It consists of several species native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions. These plants are characterized by their erect, often hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Pycnocoma species are often found in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
